text: The Château de Sablé is an historic castle in Sablé-sur-Sarthe, Sarthe, Pays de la Loire, France. ==History== The castle was built from 1717 to 1750 to the design of architect Claude Desgots for Jean-Baptiste Colbert, Marquess of Torcy.Le Château de Sablé, University of Maine Its grounds are bordered by the Vaige river. By the 19th century, it belonged to the Duke of Chaulnes. It was a chicory factory from 1919 to 1960. It was acquired by the city of Sablé-sur- Sarthe in 1960. Since 1979, it has been home to the Centre technique de conservation Joël-le-Theule of the Bibliothèque nationale de France, named in honour of local politician Joël Le Theule.Bibliothèque nationale de France: Le Centre technique de conservation Joël-le-Theule (Sablé-sur-Sarthe) ==Architectural significance== It has been listed as an official monument since 1983.French Ministry of Culture: Château de Sablé ==References== Category:Châteaux in Sarthe Category:Monuments historiques of Pays de la Loire Category:Houses completed in 1750
title: Château de Sablé
